document.heading: District of Columbia Prevention of Domestic Violence Amendment Act of 1990

history.narrative: Law 8-261, the “District of Columbia Prevention of Domestic Violence Amendment Act of 1990,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-192, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 26, 1990, and July 10, 1990, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 18, 1990, it was assigned Act No. 8-239 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
